the matrix reloaded was terrible. if you think otherwise, you are only falling in with the status quo. everyone likes it because of its potential. its potential was not nearly reached. *sigh* where do i start?
 
 i will start with 'why the matrix one was good'. why? i know exactly why. two reasons:
 
 first, the unknown. yes, that is right. what is unknown is interesting. seeing the matrix one was wonderful. everyone was unknown to what anything was. blue pill? red pill? who is morpheus? what is the matrix? very entertaining; when unknown.
 
 second, bullet time. this is why everyone wanted to see it in the first place. the bullet time effect was very new and the best graphics use for its time. it was a great concept. was...
 
 the puzzle was solved. the pieces were in its place. what else is there? everyone already knows what the matrix was. bullet time was already seen. what about the second one? anything revolutionary such as the first? hell no. nothing. it was boring, repetitive, and to top it off, keanu reaves is still the worst actor ever.
 
 philosophy? ha! that wasn't philosophy. everyone alreay knew the ending. they just took a basic concept and replaced it with hard-to-undertand-words. they made it SEEM philosphical. nothing new. horrible story. god, movies are going downhill.
 
 they spent way too much money on this sh*t. waste of my time. and p.s.: almost everyone overacted.

the matrix reloaded was terrible. if you think otherwise, you are only falling in with the status quo.
 
 
 Has nothing to do with status quo.
 The movie had excellent action sequences and a thought-provoking plot which allows everyone to have their own ideas about what will be revealed in the third movie.
 
 
everyone alreay knew the ending.
 
 
 How did everyone already know the ending?
 
 
the puzzle was solved. 
 
 
 No, it wasn't. The first movie only told us there was a Matrix. It didn't say anything about its origins, how it is used, or the role of Neo in the bigger scheme.
 
 Watch the 9 Animatrix shorts.

The movie had excellent action sequences and a thought-provoking plot which allows everyone to have their own ideas about what will be revealed in the third movie.

 it won't be even close to the famous line "luke, i am your father."

i mean, there is not much else that can be solved.

if they made just the first one and stopped, it would have been a great. gone down in history maybe. the unkown makes it interesting. 2001 was like that, people still argue over the meaning.
 
 
 2001 had a sequel, you know.
 
 
 
 might, but any movie that can't explain its self IN the movie, is not a movie. 
 
 
 The movies explain themselves fine, but for people who don't understand them, the Animatrix shorts provide extra insight.
 
 They show: 
 -How the humans discovered the machines digging
 -How the machines took over the world and enslaved humanity
 -How the matrix is updated
 -Who the kid who follows Neo is
 -How people can escape the Matrix without help from Zionists
 -How the machines think (individually, not through a hive mind)
 
 Plus, some of them have cool animation.

should have put the animatrix stuff in the movie.

 fate of humanity? they will succeed and the matrix will fall. people like a happy ending and hollywood knows this. it will end happily.

wow... I just saw the matrix (the 1st one) for the first time. That is now #1 on my movie list.
don't even bother watching the second (i liked the first).

You should at least see the second (even if its when it is on video) because you know that you will end up seeing the last one.
 
 The Matrix Reloaded is just good for the fight scenes. The first has fight scenes and a good plot.

I agree that the Matrix Reloaded is not as good as the first. The origonal Matrix tied in fight scenes, story plot, and philosophy. 
 While the second only tied in fight scenes, and plot. The plot becomes alot more complex and is left in an aggrivating cliff hanger at the end. Even so I think the overall story is a better one, but because I perfer philosophy over story I agree that the first matrix is better.
 The second one is worth seeing if you were intriguid by the plot of the origonal one.
 
 Why the fight scences were not as good as the first:
 
 It seems as more and more action movies come to the big screen technology and special affects become all the more elaborate. Just because they can do it, it seems like they have to do it. The Matrix fights scences were alot more "clean" and not completely ridiculous as the scene in which Neo must fight dozens of Agent Smiths Clones.
 
 I expect that the third will be better than the second but still probably not as good as the first.

Actually, sequels (I know I probably didn't spell that right) usually are never as good as the original because you already know the some of the characters, so the suspense of finding out how they will react in certain situations is gone. The only series where I think the sequels are better than the original one is Star Wars.
 
 Anyway, my favorite movie is Broken Arrow. But I don't get to see movies too often anymore, so most of the recent ones I haven't seen. Of all the movies mentioned here, I think I've seen one! :)
Reloaded greatly expands on the simple plot from The Matrix.

Braveheart. It has been my favorite movie for probably the last 10 years now. I don't think there will ever be a movie that will beat it as far as a mix of action, war, and drama goes. The characters were awesome, the battles were incredible, and the story was even better. There is nothing negative I can say about Braveheart.

Interview with A Vampire - You know why, Tom Cruise anyone? ;) Not to mention it was a good horror, drama, suspense movie.
 
 LOTR - Good action, stuck pretty close to the books, but not so it's a four hour movie. Legolas, Aragorn, Frodo, elves, etc. emoticon_love 
 
 Monty Python movies, particularly Holy Grail - very funny. Comic genious.
 
 The Matrix - good fight scenes, good plot, good characters. The matrix reloaded wasn't as good, but it was still worth my money, in my opinion.
 
 Braveheart - Excellent movie, just made you want to start a rebellion.
 
 That's all I can think of now. I haven't watched many of those other movies, but they sound pretty good.
